snippet: The $26.4 million initiatives by the Administration for Children’s Services are expected to be announced on Monday by Mayor Bill de Blasio, who has made overhauling child protection a priority.
abstract: New York City's Children's Services Admin will expand training and services as part of $26.4 million initiative; agency, which has been criticized over child fatalities, will receive total allocation of $2.95 billion under Mayor Bill de Blasio's 2016 budget.
lead_paragraph: The $26.4 million initiatives by the Administration for Children’s Services are expected to be announced on Monday by Mayor Bill de Blasio, who has made overhauling child protection a priority.

headline.main: New York City Children’s Services to Add Training After Fatalities
headline.print_headline: Children’s Services to Add Training After Fatalities
